etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish عقلی باشنده (aḳlı başında), from عقل (aḳl, aḳıl) and باش (baş), equivalent to akıl (“wits, reason, mind”) + -ı (possessive suffix) + baş (“head”) + -ı (possessive suffix) + -(n)da (locative suffix with "n" as buffer consonant), literally “his/her/their wits are in their head”.
